task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene with a robot arm, a pot initially with its lid on a stovetop panel, a plate on the left workspace, and a spatula tool nearby. The robot must first open the pot by removing its lid, then grasp and relocate the pot onto the plate. Finally, the robot uses the spatula as a tool to push the pot forward (toward the table’s front/operator side), achieving a final pose closer to the edge. Actions must be deliberate and respect gentle contact when placing.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are within reachable workspace
Perception can detect pot and spatula
Free space on plate for placing the pot
stepwise_plan: Detect the pot and open/remove its lid.
Compute and execute a grasp on the pot, lift slightly.
Place the pot centered on the plate and release.
Use the spatula to push the pot toward the front edge.
Set the spatula down and release.
success_criteria: Lid is no longer on the pot
Pot rests stably on the plate
Pot is pushed forward compared to its initial plate pose
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, retry detection or adjust viewpoint
If grasp slips, re-compute grasp and try again
If push direction is off, reattempt push with corrected alignment
If placement misses plate, re-grasp and re-place
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the pot is on the plate and pushed toward the front, with tool set down.

frame_3.now_evidence: Robot is executing a firm grasp on the pot near the stovetop panel.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lift and transfer to plate is the next logical move.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive a target object within timeout.
Open/remove lid from a container-like object.
Plan a grasp and write pose to blackboard.
Execute a grasp using a stored pose.
Place the object onto a named surface area.
Use a specified tool to push the target along the table.

failure_modes: Lid not detected or not removed
Push direction incorrect causing pot to slide off
recovery_strategy: Re-detect and re-open container if needed
Re-grasp and re-place to center on plate
Repeat push with adjusted direction and smaller distance
assumptions: OpenContainer with container_type='pot' models removing the lid seen in early frames.
Direction 180° corresponds to pushing toward the table front (bottom of image).
Spatula is the referenced 'tool' in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Lid removed; pot visible without lid
Pot placed on plate with stable support
Pot moved forward along table using spatula
